analyzed: rtag pa dang / chad par rnam par rtog pa dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa srangs pa'o //

analyzed: ji ltar rtag pa ma yin pa ni /

analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i 'phags pa thams cad so so rang gis rtogs par byed de /

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

original: 'chi ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'chi ba ma yin no //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa gal te 'chi ba zhig yin na ni da dung yang skye ba'i rgyud du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'jig pa ma yin /

original: 'chi ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'chi ba ma yin te /

analyzed: de la / blo gros chen po /

original: de la / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: de la / blo gros chen po /

analyzed: snyems pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: des mi snyems so //

analyzed: de de ltar mi snyems pa'ang gzhan du bdag gis so so rang gis rig pa'i khyad par du 'gro bar yongs su bsngo ste / tshul khrims kyi yan lag gis rnam par mi rtog pa /
translated: And they dedicate that very lack of conceit to the attainment of their own individual self-awareness.🔽They apply the aspect of moral conduct to the nonconceptual

analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs snyems pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //

analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: kun nas spyor ba gsum spangs pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa la ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug mi 'byung ngo //

original: blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos gsol pa /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / blo gros @164a *//
translated: The Blessed One replied:🔽“Mahāmati,

analyzed: chen po; yul la lus kyi dbang po'i 'dod chags bud med dang phrad pa las skyes pa /

analyzed: blo gros chen po; lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na /

original: de'i phyir lan gcig phyir 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir lan gcig phyir 'ong ba zhes bya'o //

original: de la / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: de la / blo gros chen po /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dngos po yod pa dang / med pa la mi 'jug pa dang / lta ba'i nyes pa bag la nyal gyi rnam par rtog pa mi 'ong bsan phyir mi 'ong ba ste /
translated: They are called “nonreturners” because they do not engage with the characteristics of past, future, and present forms, whether they are considered to be real or unreal, and because the conceptual thoughts of the faults of views do not arise.

original: @164b kun nas sbyor ba rnams spangs pas na phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @164b kun nas sbyor ba rnams spangs pas na phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “nonreturners” because they have abandoned the fetters.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: dgra bcom pa ni bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan du bya ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa dang / stobs dang / mngon par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal la rnam par rtog pa med pas dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan du bya ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa dang / stobs dang / mngon par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal la rnam par rtog pa med pas dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: they are called “worthy ones” because they do not conceptualize concentration, the object of concentration, samādhi, liberation, power, superknowledge, affliction, or suffering.

original: blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos gsol pa /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i sgra 'di gang dang sbyar /

analyzed: 'on te 'phrul pas sprul pa lags /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: blo gros chen po; zhi ba phyogs gcig gi lam rab tu thob pas nyan thos yin te /

analyzed: gzhan dag ma yin no //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

translated: through practicing the conduct of bodhisattvas, there are other emanations of the Buddha’s magical power and speech who, through the prior attainment of skillful means and aspirations, manifest birth in the assembly in order to beautify the circle of the Buddha’s retinue.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa'i gnas gzhan sna tshogs bstan pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan du bya ba @165a *//

analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /

analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang // dgra bcom nyid kyang sems 'khrul bar // bsam gtan bsam bya bsam gtan pa //

analyzed: spong dang bden pa mthong ba dang // de dag rtog pa tsam yin par //

analyzed: gang gis @165b rtogs pa de 'grol lo //

analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /

analyzed: blo rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: blo gang gis dngos po'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid la rab tu gzhigs na mtha' bzhi dang bral ba mi dmigs te /

analyzed: de ni rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i blo'o //
translated: That is the mind that thoroughly differentiates.🔽Regarding that,

original: de la / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: de la / blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: mtha' bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtha' bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: the four extremes are as follows:

analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: chos thams cad ni mtha' bzhi po de dag dang bral ba zhes bya'o //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: mtha' bzhi pa 'di chos thams cad yongs su brtags pa la rab tu sbyar bar bya'o //

original: de la / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: de la / blo gros chen po /

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa la mngon par chags pas rab tu 'jog pa'i blo gang zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

analyzed: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: @166a *// rgyu dang / mtshan nyid dang / dpe la mngon par chags pas yang dag pa ma yin pa sgro 'dogs pas sgro 'dogs te /

analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa la mngon par chags pas rab tu 'jog pa'i blo'o //

analyzed: blo gros chen po / de ni blo gnyis kyi mtshan nyid de /

analyzed: blo gnyis kyi mtshan nyid gang dang ldan pas /
translated: Through possessing the characteristic of the two minds,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs par khong du chud cing /

analyzed: snang ba med pa'i blo rab tu rnam par 'byed pa spyod pa'i sa la mkhas pa rnams sa dang po rab tu 'thob ste /
translated: and who have the wisdom to discern the absence of appearances attain the first bhūmi.

original: ting nge 'dzin brgya la snyoms par 'jug /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin brgya la snyoms par 'jug /
translated: They enter a hundred samādhis,

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi bye brag rab tu 'thob pas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' brgya'ang mthong /

analyzed: 'byed pa la mngon par chags shing 'byung bas bag chags kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa shin tu rgyas par byed do //

original: yid dang lhan cig tu bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa la mngon par chags pas ngar sems pa lta bur rjes su 'jug ste /
analyzed: yid dang lhan cig tu bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa la mngon par chags pas ngar sems pa lta bur rjes su 'jug ste /
translated: Together with the mind, it is attached to grasping self and mine, and thus it engages in the manner of thinking I.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyur gyur cing de la dmigs pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyur gyur cing de la dmigs pa las tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The ālaya consciousness is the cause, and the characteristics are not separate from that which is observed.

original: rang gi sems snang ba'i yul la mngon par chags pas gcig gi rgyur gcig gyur pa'i sems pa 'dus pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba'i yul la mngon par chags pas gcig gi rgyur gcig gyur pa'i sems pa 'dus pa 'byung ste /
translated: Through attachment to the objects that appear to one’s own mind, the accumulation of intentions that are the cause of one [consciousness] becoming many arises.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: rgya mtsho'i rlabs lta bur rang gi sems snang ba'i yul gyi rlung gis bskyod pas 'jug cing ldog go /
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i rlabs lta bur rang gi sems snang ba'i yul gyi rlung gis bskyod pas 'jug cing ldog go /
translated: the waves of the ocean are moved by the wind of the objects that appear to one’s own mind, and so they move and stop.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzlog pas rnam par shes pa bdun rnams kyang ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzlog pas rnam par shes pa bdun rnams kyang ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: by stopping the mental consciousness, the seven consciousnesses will also stop.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
translated: About this, the following is said:

original: bya ba dang ni mtshan nyid dang // dngos por mya ngan nga mi 'da'//
analyzed: bya ba dang ni mtshan nyid dang // dngos por mya ngan nga mi 'da'//
translated: “I do not pass into nirvāṇa in terms of action, characteristics, and things.

original: rnam rtog rnam par shes pa las; ;bzlog pas mya ngan nga 'das so //
analyzed: rnam rtog rnam par shes pa las; ;bzlog pas mya ngan nga 'das so //
translated: I have passed into nirvāṇa by stopping the conceptual consciousness.

original: de rgyu de la dmigs pa ste //
analyzed: de rgyu de la dmigs pa ste //
translated: That is the cause and that is the observed object,

original: yid kyi rgyud kyang shin tu gnas //
analyzed: yid kyi rgyud kyang shin tu gnas //
translated: and the continuum of mind also abides.”

original: sems kyi rgyud rnams de 'byin te //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud rnams de 'byin te //
translated: The continuum of mind gives rise to them.

original: rnam par shes pa'ang rab tu gnas //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'ang rab tu gnas //
translated: Consciousness also is well established.

original: ji ltar chu chen zad nas ni //
analyzed: ji ltar chu chen zad nas ni //
translated: Just as when the great water is exhausted,

original: rlabs rnams kun tu'ang mi 'byung ltar //
analyzed: rlabs rnams kun tu'ang mi 'byung ltar //
translated: Waves do not arise at all,

original: de bzhin rnam shes sna tshogs kyang //
analyzed: de bzhin rnam shes sna tshogs kyang //
translated: In the same way, when consciousness is stopped,

original: 'gags na 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gags na 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The various [appearances] will not arise.

original: gzhan @169b yang; blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan @169b yang; blo gros chen po /
translated: Moreover, Mahāmati,

original: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin rab tu dbye ba'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid rab tu tha dad pa rtogs pa gang gis khyod dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan rnams rnam par rtog pa dang / brtags pa spangs shing /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin rab tu dbye ba'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid rab tu tha dad pa rtogs pa gang gis khyod dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan rnams rnam par rtog pa dang / brtags pa spangs shing /
translated: through the realization of the characteristics of the mode of the division of the imagined nature, you and other bodhisattva mahāsattvas will abandon conceptualization and imputation,

original: 'phags pa bdag gi so so rang gis rig pa dang / mu stegs can gyi tshul dang / yul shin tu mthong ba'i blo gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs nas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad pa kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin lta bur so sor mi rtog par 'gyur ba'i kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin rab tu dbye ba'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'phags pa bdag gi so so rang gis rig pa dang / mu stegs can gyi tshul dang / yul shin tu mthong ba'i blo gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs nas gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad pa kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin lta bur so sor mi rtog par 'gyur ba'i kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin rab tu dbye ba'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: The noble self-awareness, the non-Buddhist systems, the grasping of the mind that sees the object very clearly, and the conceptualization of the apprehender and the apprehended are abandoned. The characteristic of the dependent nature, which is various and of different kinds, is taught as the characteristic of the mode of the division of the imagined nature.

original: de la / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: de la / blo gros chen po /
translated: Here, Mahāmati,

original: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin rab tu dbye ba'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin rab tu dbye ba'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: what is the characteristic of the mode of the division of the imagined nature?

original: 'di lta ste; brjod pa la rnam par rtog pa dang / smra bar bya ba la rnam par rtog pa dang / mtshan nyid la rnam par rtog pa dang / nor la rnam par rtog pa dang / rang bzhin la rnam par rtog pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste; brjod pa la rnam par rtog pa dang / smra bar bya ba la rnam par rtog pa dang / mtshan nyid la rnam par rtog pa dang / nor la rnam par rtog pa dang / rang bzhin la rnam par rtog pa dang /
translated: It is as follows: conceptualization of expression, conceptualization of what is to be expressed, conceptualization of characteristics, conceptualization of wealth, conceptualization of nature,

original: rgyu la rnam par rtog pa dang / lta ba la rnam par rtog pa dang / rig pa la rnam par rtog pa dang / skye ba la rnam par rtog pa dang / skye ba med pa la rnam par rtog pa dang / 'brel ba la rnam par rtog pa dang /
analyzed: rgyu la rnam par rtog pa dang / lta ba la rnam par rtog pa dang / rig pa la rnam par rtog pa dang / skye ba la rnam par rtog pa dang / skye ba med pa la rnam par rtog pa dang / 'brel ba la rnam par rtog pa dang /
translated: conceptualization of causes, conceptualization of views, conceptualization of awareness, conceptualization of arising, conceptualization of non-arising, conceptualization of connection,

original: bcings pa dang ma bcings pa la rnam par rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: bcings pa dang ma bcings pa la rnam par rtog pa yin te /
translated: and conceptualization of bondage and non-bondage.

original: de ni / blo gros chen po /🔽brjod pa yongs su brtags pa'i rang bzhin rab tu dbye ba'i @170a *//
analyzed: de ni / blo gros chen po / brjod pa yongs su brtags pa'i rang bzhin rab tu dbye ba'i @170a *//
translated: Mahāmati,

original: tshul gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: tshul gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: this is the characteristic of the method of the classification of the nature of the examination of expressions.

original: de la / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: de la / blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: brjod pa la rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: brjod pa la rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: what is conceptualization of expressions?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: dbyangs dang glu snyan pa sna tshogs la mngon par chags pa yin te /
analyzed: dbyangs dang glu snyan pa sna tshogs la mngon par chags pa yin te /
translated: attachment to various melodious songs.

original: de ni blo gros chen po /
analyzed: de ni blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: brjod pa la rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa la rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: that is conceptualization of expressions.

original: de la blo gros chen po smra bar bya ba la rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la blo gros chen po smra bar bya ba la rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: Mahāmati, what is conceptualization of the expressible?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: gang ci'ang rung smra bar bya ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin 'phags pa'i ye shes dang / rtogs pas shes par bya ba gang la gnas te /
analyzed: gang ci'ang rung smra bar bya ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin 'phags pa'i ye shes dang / rtogs pas shes par bya ba gang la gnas te /
translated: The nature of any object whatsoever that is to be expressed is the object of knowledge of the noble ones' wisdom and realization.

original: brjod pa 'jug par 'gyur ba yod do zhes rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa 'jug par 'gyur ba yod do zhes rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: It is conceptual thought to think, It exists, in terms of the engagement of expression.

original: de la blo gros chen po mtshan nyid la rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la blo gros chen po mtshan nyid la rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What, then, is the conceptual thought of characteristics?

original: smra bar bya ba smig rgyu lta bu la mtshan nyid sna tshogs su mngon par chags pas mngon par zhen te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: smra bar bya ba smig rgyu lta bu la mtshan nyid sna tshogs su mngon par chags pas mngon par zhen te / 'di lta ste /
translated: It is to conceive of and cling to the various characteristics of things that are to be expressed, which are like mirages.

original: dngos po thams cad la tsha ba dang / gsher ba dang / g-yo ba dang / sra ba'i mtshan nyid du rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad la tsha ba dang / gsher ba dang / g-yo ba dang / sra ba'i mtshan nyid du rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: It is conceptual thought in terms of the characteristics of heat, wetness, movement, and solidity in all things.

original: de la nor la rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la nor la rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What is the conceptual thought of wealth?

original: gser dang / dngul dang / nor rin po che rnam pa mang po'i yul brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gser dang / dngul dang / nor rin po che rnam pa mang po'i yul brjod pa'o //
translated: It is the expression of the objects of many kinds of precious wealth, such as gold, silver, and so on.

original: de la rang bzhin la rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin la rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: What is the conceptual thought of nature?

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du 'dzin cing /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du 'dzin cing /
translated: They grasp at the essence of things.

original: 'di lta ste; 'di ni 'di bzhin gyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes log par rnam par rtog pa'i lta bas rnam par lta'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste; 'di ni 'di bzhin gyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes log par rnam par rtog pa'i lta bas rnam par lta'o //
translated: They view things in terms of the views of wrong conceptual thoughts, such as ‘this is like this’ or ‘this is not like that.’

original: de la rgyu la rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rgyu la rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is conceptualizing causes?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: rgyu dang rkyen gang @170b gis rgyu'i mtshan nyid las skye ba yod pa dang / med par snang bar byed pa de ni rgyu la rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gang @170b gis rgyu'i mtshan nyid las skye ba yod pa dang / med par snang bar byed pa de ni rgyu la rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The appearance of existence and nonexistence that arises from the characteristics of causes and conditions is conceptualizing causes.

original: de la lta ba la rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la lta ba la rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is conceptualizing views?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: yod pa dang / med pa dang / gcig pa dang / tha dad pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin par log par lta ba'i mu stegs can gyi rnam par rtog pa la mngon par chags pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang / med pa dang / gcig pa dang / tha dad pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin par log par lta ba'i mu stegs can gyi rnam par rtog pa la mngon par chags pa'o //
translated: It is the attachment to the conceptual thoughts of tīrthikas who have wrong views of existence, nonexistence, sameness, difference, both, and neither.

original: de la rigs la rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rigs la rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is conceptualizing lineages?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bdag dang bdag gi mtshan nyid rigs pas brtsad de ston pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi mtshan nyid rigs pas brtsad de ston pa'o //
translated: It is the teaching of the characteristics of the self and that which belongs to the self through debate.

original: de la skye ba la rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la skye ba la rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the conceptual thought of arising?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: rkyen rnams kyi dngos po yod pa dang / med pa skye bar mngon par chags pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen rnams kyi dngos po yod pa dang / med pa skye bar mngon par chags pa'o //
translated: attachment to the arising of existent and nonexistent things from conditions.

original: de la mi skye ba la rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mi skye ba la rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the conceptual thought of non-arising?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa'i lus sngon ma skyes pa yin te; ma byung ba las rkyen gyis 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad rgyu med pa'i lus sngon ma skyes pa yin te; ma byung ba las rkyen gyis 'byung ba'o //
translated: the body of all things is unarisen from a previous non-arising, and arises from conditions that did not exist.

original: de la 'brel bar rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'brel bar rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the conceptual thought of connection?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: gser gyi skud pa bzhin du gang dang gang du 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: gser gyi skud pa bzhin du gang dang gang du 'brel ba'o //
translated: like a golden thread, it is connected to this and that.

original: de la bcings pa dang; ma bcings pa la rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bcings pa dang; ma bcings pa la rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the conceptual thought of bondage and non-bondage?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bcings pa'i rgyu dang / bcing bar bya ba mngon par chags pa bzhin te /
analyzed: bcings pa'i rgyu dang / bcing bar bya ba mngon par chags pa bzhin te /
translated: like attachment to the cause of bondage and the bound,

original: ji ltar skyes bu thabs dang ldan pas thag pa la mdud pa bor ba dang 'grol ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bu thabs dang ldan pas thag pa la mdud pa bor ba dang 'grol ba lta bu'o //
translated: just as a person with skill can tie a knot in a rope and untie it.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: de dag ni kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin rab tu dbye ba'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de dag ni kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin rab tu dbye ba'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: These are the characteristics of the mode of the classification of the imagined nature.

original: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin rab tu dby @171a *//
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin rab tu dby @171a *//
translated: The mode of the classification of the imagined nature.

original: pa'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid de la byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad mngon par chags te /
analyzed: pa'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid de la byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad mngon par chags te /
translated: All foolish ordinary beings are attached to it.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la yod pa dang med par mngon par chags pas yongs su brtags pa'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs la mngon par chags te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid la yod pa dang med par mngon par chags pas yongs su brtags pa'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs la mngon par chags te /
translated: because of attachment to existence and nonexistence in the characteristics of the dependent, they become attached to the various characteristics of the imagined.

original: sgyu ma'i gnas sna tshogs mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i gnas sna tshogs mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like seeing various illusory things.

original: byis pa rnams kyi sgyu ma gzhan du mthong ba'i blos rnam par rtog ste /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyi sgyu ma gzhan du mthong ba'i blos rnam par rtog ste /
translated: Foolish people conceive of illusions as different things with their minds.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: sna tshogs dang sgyu ma ni gcig pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: sna tshogs dang sgyu ma ni gcig pa'ang ma yin /
translated: the various and the illusory are not the same,

original: tha dad pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: nor are they different.

original: gal te tha dad na ni sna tshogs sgyu ma'i rgyu las byung ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te tha dad na ni sna tshogs sgyu ma'i rgyu las byung ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were different, the various would not arise from the cause of illusion.

original: de ste sna tshogs dang tha mi dad na ni sgyu ma dang / sna tshogs bye brag med par 'gyur ro //🔽de'i bye brag mthong bas na gcig pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de ste sna tshogs dang tha mi dad na ni sgyu ma dang / sna tshogs bye brag med par 'gyur ro // de'i bye brag mthong bas na gcig pa'ang ma yin /
translated: If it were not different from the variety, then the illusion and the variety would be indistinguishable.

original: tha dad pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: But since their differences are seen, they are neither the same nor different.🔽Therefore, Mahamati, you and the other bodhisattvas should not be attached to the existence or nonexistence of illusions.

original: des na de'i phyir blo gros chen po khyod dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan dag gis sgyu ma la yod pa dang med par mi chags par bya'o; ;de la 'di skad ces bya ste //
analyzed: des na de'i phyir blo gros chen po khyod dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan dag gis sgyu ma la yod pa dang med par mi chags par bya'o; ;de la 'di skad ces bya ste //
translated: This is what is meant:

original: sems ni yul dang kun tu 'brel //
analyzed: sems ni yul dang kun tu 'brel //
translated: The mind is connected with objects,

original: rtog pa la ni rnam shes 'jug /
analyzed: rtog pa la ni rnam shes 'jug /
translated: and consciousness engages with conceptualization.

original: snang ba med dang bye phrag la //
analyzed: snang ba med dang bye phrag la //
translated: In the absence of appearances,

original: shes rab yang dag rab tu 'jug /
analyzed: shes rab yang dag rab tu 'jug /
translated: wisdom truly engages.

original: kun brtags pa yi rang bzhin yod //
analyzed: kun brtags pa yi rang bzhin yod //
translated: The imagined nature exists,

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni med pa ste //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni med pa ste //
translated: but the dependent is nonexistent.

original: nor ba dag gis brtags pa snang //
analyzed: nor ba dag gis brtags pa snang //
translated: Appearances are imagined by error,

original: gzhan gyi dbang la mi rtog go /🔽yan lag dbang pos grub pa yi //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang la mi rtog go / yan lag dbang pos grub pa yi //
translated: but the dependent is not conceptualized.

original: sgyu @171b ma ji ltar mi grub pa //
analyzed: sgyu @171b ma ji ltar mi grub pa //
translated: Just as an illusion is not established🔽by the combination of parts and faculties,

original: de bzhin mtshan ma sna tshogs kyang //
analyzed: de bzhin mtshan ma sna tshogs kyang //
translated: Likewise, various signs

original: rab tu brtags na mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: rab tu brtags na mi 'grub bo //
translated: are not established when thoroughly examined.

original: mtshan ma gnas ngan len gyi dngos //
analyzed: mtshan ma gnas ngan len gyi dngos //
translated: The entity of the negative tendencies of signs

original: 'ching ba sems las byung ba ste //
analyzed: 'ching ba sems las byung ba ste //
translated: is bondage arisen from the mind.

original: mi shes rnams kyis kun brtags pa //
analyzed: mi shes rnams kyis kun brtags pa //
translated: Imagined by the ignorant,

original: gzhan gyi dbang du'ang rnam par rtog /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang du'ang rnam par rtog /
translated: it is also imagined as dependent.

original: gang 'di brtags pa'i dngos po ni //
analyzed: gang 'di brtags pa'i dngos po ni //
translated: That which is imagined here

original: de nyid gzhan gyi dbang yin te //
analyzed: de nyid gzhan gyi dbang yin te //
translated: is itself the dependent.

original: brtags pa sna tshogs snang ba ni //
analyzed: brtags pa sna tshogs snang ba ni //
translated: The appearance of various imaginations

original: gzhan gyi dbang du de brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang du de brjod do //
translated: is said to be the dependent.

original: kun rdzob dang ni don dam ste //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang ni don dam ste //
translated: The conventional and the ultimate

original: rgyu las skyes pa gsum du med //
analyzed: rgyu las skyes pa gsum du med //
translated: are not produced from causes.

original: brtags pa dag ni kun rdzob bshad //
analyzed: brtags pa dag ni kun rdzob bshad //
translated: Imagination is explained as conventional,

original: de 'chad 'phags pa'i spyod yul lo //
analyzed: de 'chad 'phags pa'i spyod yul lo //
translated: and its explanation is the domain of the noble ones.

original: rnal 'byor can gyi dngos po ltar //
analyzed: rnal 'byor can gyi dngos po ltar //
translated: Just as things appear to yogis,

original: sna tshogs gcig tu rnam mdzes kyang //
analyzed: sna tshogs gcig tu rnam mdzes kyang //
translated: various [things] are seen as one.

original: de la sna tshogs yod pa min //

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /

original: yod pa dang med par lta ba'i phyogs su lhung @183b ba'i mu stegs byed kyi lta ba la so sor rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags shin tu rgyas pa rnams kyi phyi rol gyi don sna tshogs dmigs pa la mngon par chags pa dang / bdag dang bdag gir mngon par chags pas rnam par rtog pa zhes bsgrags pa sems dang sems las byung ba mang po 'byung ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yod pa dang med par lta ba'i phyogs su lhung @183b ba'i mu stegs byed kyi lta ba la so sor rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags shin tu rgyas pa rnams kyi phyi rol gyi don sna tshogs dmigs pa la mngon par chags pa dang / bdag dang bdag gir mngon par chags pas rnam par rtog pa zhes bsgrags pa sems dang sems las byung ba mang po 'byung ba 'byung ngo //
translated: The various external objects that are perceived by those who are attached to the views of the tīrthikas, who have fallen into the extreme of the views of existence and nonexistence, and who have very extensive latent propensities for discriminating those views, and the many minds and mental factors that are proclaimed to be conceptual thoughts due to attachment to “I” and “mine” arise.

original: blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos gsol pa /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / gal te don rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs su yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su rtogs pa la mngon par chags pas mi rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba 'byung ste /
translated: Bhagavān,🔽if thoughts arise due to attachment to the various unreal conceptual thoughts of objects,

original: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs la lta bar lhung ba /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs la lta bar lhung ba /
translated: then the views of those who have fallen into the extreme of existence and nonexistence

original: gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / mu stegs byed kyi lta ba la so so rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags rgyas pa rnams phyi rol gyi don sna tshogs su dmigs pa la mngon par chags shing rang gi sems snang ba tsam du ma rig pa dang /

translated: The various appearances of one’s mind are not recognized, and one is attached to the various external objects that are observed.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i dngos po sna tshogs la mngon par chags pas rnam par rtog pa zhes bsgrags pa sems dang sems las byung ba mang po 'byung ba 'byung ba na /

translated: When the various things that are imputed as existent and nonexistent arise, the many minds and mental factors that are proclaimed to be conceptual thoughts arise.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

translated: the various external objects that are the characteristics of existence and nonexistence, which are the characteristics of falling into the positions of existence and nonexistence, are empty of things and nonthings.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: don dam pa'ang tshad ma dang / dbang po dang / cha shas dang / dpe dang / rgyu'i mtshan @184a *//
analyzed: don dam pa'ang tshad ma dang / dbang po dang / cha shas dang / dpe dang / rgyu'i mtshan @184a *//
translated: The ultimate is also a valid cognition, a sense faculty, a part, an example, and a cause.🔽

original: nyid las rnam par bzlog pa na /
analyzed: nyid las rnam par bzlog pa na /
translated: The ultimate is also the opposite of valid cognition, the sense faculties, parts, examples, and causes.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: gcig la yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don sna tshogs kyi dngos po yod pa dang / med par mngon par chags pa la so sor rnam par rtog cing rnam par rtog pa 'byung gi /

translated: when the various unreal things in one thing are conceived of as existent or nonexistent, then conceptual thought arises.🔽But when one is attached to the characteristics of the ultimate, conceptual thought does not arise.

original: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid la mngon par chags shing rnam par rtog pas ni rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba ji lta bu; bcom ldan 'das /🔽gcig la ni 'byung /

translated: Blessed One,

original: gcig la ni mi 'byung zhes gsung na /
analyzed: gcig la ni mi 'byung zhes gsung na /
translated: if you say that conceptual thought arises in one thing but not in another,

original: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs la mngon par chags pa dang / khyod la mi mtshungs pa'i rgyur smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs la mngon par chags pa dang / khyod la mi mtshungs pa'i rgyur smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then you will be accused of speaking in a way that is attached to the positions of existence and nonexistence.

original: yang dag pa ma yin par rnam par rtog pa'i lta ba 'byung bar gsung na /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin par rnam par rtog pa'i lta ba 'byung bar gsung na /
translated: If you say that the view of unreal conceptualization arises,

original: sgyu ma'i yan lag gi skyes bu tha dad pa rnam pa sna tshogs las gzugs gcig grub pa bzhin du so sor rnam par rtog pas mtshan nyid sna tshogs su rnam par brtags pas dngos po dang / dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa las bzlog pa'i phyir 'jig rten rgyang pan gyi lta ba dang bsam par lhung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i yan lag gi skyes bu tha dad pa rnam pa sna tshogs las gzugs gcig grub pa bzhin du so sor rnam par rtog pas mtshan nyid sna tshogs su rnam par brtags pas dngos po dang / dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa las bzlog pa'i phyir 'jig rten rgyang pan gyi lta ba dang bsam par lhung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as a single form is created from various different parts of an illusory person, in the same way, due to the various characteristics imputed by individual conceptualization, one falls into the views and thoughts of the Lokāyatas due to the conceptualization of existence and nonexistence.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: blo gros chen po /🔽rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: blo gros chen po / rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba'am /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: ldog pa med do //
analyzed: ldog pa med do //
translated: conceptualization does not arise or cease.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

analyzed: yod pa dang med pa las rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba dang / phyi rol snang ba'i dngos po med pa dang / rang gi sems snang ba tsam du rtog pas /
translated: Conceptualization does not arise from existence or nonexistence, external appearing things do not exist, and by realizing that it is merely one's own mind appearing,

original: blo gros @184b chen po; rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba'ang med /🔽ldog pa'ang med de /
analyzed: blo gros @184b chen po; rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba'ang med / ldog pa'ang med de /
translated: Mahāmati, conceptualization does not arise or cease.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: gzhan du na byis pa rnams kyi rang gi sems sna tshogs kyi rnam par rtog pas brtags pa dang / sna tshogs kyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid la mngon par chags pas lo rgyus las byung ba sngon du 'gro ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'byung bar bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan du na byis pa rnams kyi rang gi sems sna tshogs kyi rnam par rtog pas brtags pa dang / sna tshogs kyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid la mngon par chags pas lo rgyus las byung ba sngon du 'gro ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'byung bar bshad do //
translated: Otherwise, it is explained that the conceptual thoughts of the various minds of childish beings arise from the prior conditions of their attachment to the characteristics of various things.

original: ji ltar na byis pa so so'i skye bo 'di dag rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i sems tsam du khong du chud pa dang / bdag dang bdag gir mngon par chags pa las lta ba rnam par bzlog ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na byis pa so so'i skye bo 'di dag rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i sems tsam du khong du chud pa dang / bdag dang bdag gir mngon par chags pa las lta ba rnam par bzlog ste /
translated: How do they cause childish ordinary beings to understand that it is merely their own conceptual minds, and how do they cause them to turn away from the views that arise from attachment to “I” and “mine”?

original: rgyu dang / rkyen dang / 'bras bu'i nyes pa las bzlog cing rang gi sems snang ba tsam du rtogs pas sems dang bsam pa shin tu gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu dang / rkyen dang / 'bras bu'i nyes pa las bzlog cing rang gi sems snang ba tsam du rtogs pas sems dang bsam pa shin tu gyur te /
translated: They cause them to turn away from the faults of causes, conditions, and results, and they cause them to realize that it is merely the appearances of their own minds.🔽Thus, their minds and thoughts are transformed,

original: sa thams cad la rigs par byas shing /
analyzed: sa thams cad la rigs par byas shing /
translated: and they are brought to all the stages.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bdag gi so so rang gis rig pa'i spyod yul chos lnga dang / rang bzhin dang / dngos po dang / lta ba dang / rnam par rtog pa ldog pa thob par 'gyur zhes te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bdag gi so so rang gis rig pa'i spyod yul chos lnga dang / rang bzhin dang / dngos po dang / lta ba dang / rnam par rtog pa ldog pa thob par 'gyur zhes te /
translated: “Tathāgatas, the domain of my own individual awareness, will attain the five dharmas, the nature, entities, views, and the reversal of conceptuality.”

original: des na de'i phyir /
analyzed: des na de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: 'di ltar sgyu ma la rnam par rtog pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don sna tshogs la mngon par chags pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgyu ma la rnam par rtog pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don sna tshogs la mngon par chags pa 'byung ste /
translated: in this way, in illusion, the arising of attachment to various unreal objects is conceptualization.

original: rang gi rnam par rtog pa sna tshogs kyi don la yang dag pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pas rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhes ngas smras so //
analyzed: rang gi rnam par rtog pa sna tshogs kyi don la yang dag pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pas rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhes ngas smras so //
translated: I say that through the correct knowledge of the meaning of one’s various concepts, one will be liberated.”

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /🔽rgyu rnams dang ni rkyen rnams kyis //
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste / rgyu rnams dang ni rkyen rnams kyis //
translated: Regarding that, it is said:

original: gang rnams 'jig rten 'byung zhes pa //
analyzed: gang rnams 'jig rten 'byung zhes pa //
translated: Those who say that the world arises🔽From causes and conditions

original: mtha' @185a *// bzhi dang ni ldan pa ste //
analyzed: mtha' @185a *// bzhi dang ni ldan pa ste //
translated: Possess the four extremes

original: de dag nga yi tshul mi shes //
analyzed: de dag nga yi tshul mi shes //
translated: And do not know my way.🔽Those who say that the world arises

original: rgyu dag dang ni rkyen rnams las //
analyzed: rgyu dag dang ni rkyen rnams las //
translated: From causes and conditions🔽Possess the four extremes🔽And do not know my way.

original: 'jig rten yod med mi skye ste //
analyzed: 'jig rten yod med mi skye ste //
translated: The world does not arise from existence or nonexistence.

original: gang na'ang yod med yod min na //
analyzed: gang na'ang yod med yod min na //
translated: Since it does not exist as existence or nonexistence,

original: byis pa rnams kyis ji ltar brtag /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis ji ltar brtag /
translated: how can childish beings conceive of it?

original: yod min med min yod med min //
analyzed: yod min med min yod med min //
translated: It is not existent, not nonexistent, and not even existent and nonexistent.

original: de ltar 'jig rten nam mthong na //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten nam mthong na //
translated: When the world is seen in this way,

original: de tshe sems kyang rnam ldog ste //
analyzed: de tshe sems kyang rnam ldog ste //
translated: then the mind also turns away

original: bdag med par yang rtog par 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag med par yang rtog par 'gyur //
translated: and one will realize selflessness.

original: gang phyir rkyen las byung bas na //
analyzed: gang phyir rkyen las byung bas na //
translated: Since it arises from conditions,

original: dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa //
translated: all things are unarisen.

original: rkyen rnams thams cad 'bras bu ste //
analyzed: rkyen rnams thams cad 'bras bu ste //
translated: All conditions are results;

original: 'bras bu las ni srid mi skye //
analyzed: 'bras bu las ni srid mi skye //
translated: from results, existence is not born.

original: 'bras bu gnyis su 'gyur bas na //
analyzed: 'bras bu gnyis su 'gyur bas na //
translated: Since the result would be twofold,

original: 'bras bu la ni 'bras mi skye //
analyzed: 'bras bu la ni 'bras mi skye //
translated: a result does not arise from a result.

original: rnam pa gnyis su rab 'gyur bas //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su rab 'gyur bas //
translated: Since it would be twofold,

original: 'bras bu'i dngos po mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dngos po mi dmigs so //
translated: the entity of the result is not observed.

original: dmigs dang dmigs bya med par yang //
analyzed: dmigs dang dmigs bya med par yang //
translated: Since there is neither an object of observation nor an observer,

original: nam zhig 'dus byas rnams mthong na //
analyzed: nam zhig 'dus byas rnams mthong na //
translated: when conditioned things are seen,

original: sems med pa yi sems tsam ste //

analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mchog gi ye shes ni sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snang ba med pa'i chos la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gog pa med par mthong ba dang /
translated: The supreme supramundane wisdom is that of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, who see the non-appearance of phenomena, who see the non-arising and non-ceasing,

original: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba /
translated: who are free from the positions of existence and non-existence,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas @188a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas @188a *//
translated: and who are the Tathāgatas.

original: bdag med pa thugs su chud pa'i phyir 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa thugs su chud pa'i phyir 'byung ba'o //
translated: It arises because of the realization of selflessness.

original: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
translated: Moreover, Mahāmati,

original: chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni ye shes so //
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni ye shes so //
translated: the characteristic of non-attachment is wisdom,

original: yul sna tshogs la chags pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: yul sna tshogs la chags pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: and the characteristic of attachment to various objects is consciousness.

original: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
translated: Moreover, Mahāmati,

original: gsum du 'dus pa'i bya ba skye ba dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par shes so //
analyzed: gsum du 'dus pa'i bya ba skye ba dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par shes so //
translated: The third is consciousness, which has the characteristic of being endowed with the activity of the three.

original: mi ldan pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ye shes so //
analyzed: mi ldan pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ye shes so //
translated: The fourth is intuition, which has the characteristic of being devoid of the three.

original: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
translated: Moreover, Mahamati,

original: thob pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni ye shes te /
analyzed: thob pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni ye shes te /
translated: intuition has the characteristic of being unobtainable.

original: bdag gi so so rang gi 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs pa'i spyod yul du mi 'byung ba'i phyir chu la chu zla bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag gi so so rang gi 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs pa'i spyod yul du mi 'byung ba'i phyir chu la chu zla bzhin no //
translated: It does not appear as the domain of the experience of the individual intuition of the noble ones, like the moon in the water.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ste //
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste //
translated: About this, the following is said:

original: sems kyis su ni las rnams gsog /
analyzed: sems kyis su ni las rnams gsog /
translated: The mind accumulates karma,

original: ye shes kyis ni rnam par 'byed //
analyzed: ye shes kyis ni rnam par 'byed //
translated: but intuition distinguishes it.

original: shes rab kyis kyang snang med dang // mthu yang rab tu thob par byed //
analyzed: shes rab kyis kyang snang med dang // mthu yang rab tu thob par byed //
translated: And wisdom also attains the absence of appearances and power.

original: sems ni yul dang 'brel pa ste //
analyzed: sems ni yul dang 'brel pa ste //
translated: The mind is connected with objects,

original: rtog ge dag la ye shes 'jug /
analyzed: rtog ge dag la ye shes 'jug /
translated: and intuition engages in sophistries.🔽Wisdom truly engages

original: snang ba med dang bye brag la //🔽shes rab yang dag rab tu 'jug /
analyzed: snang ba med dang bye brag la // shes rab yang dag rab tu 'jug /
translated: in the absence of appearances and distinctions.

original: sems dang yid dang rnam shes dang / 'du shes rtog pa spangs pa ste //
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam shes dang / 'du shes rtog pa spangs pa ste //
translated: The mind, thought, consciousness, and discrimination are abandoned,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i chos thob pa //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i chos thob pa //
translated: And attain the Dharma of conceptualization.

original: nyan thos rnams ni rgyal sras min //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni rgyal sras min //
translated: The hearers are not the victors’ heirs.

original: zhing dang bzod pa'i khyad par la //
analyzed: zhing dang bzod pa'i khyad par la //
translated: The distinctive fields and patience

original: de bzhin gshegs kyi ye shes dge /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs kyi ye shes dge /
translated: Are the thus-gone ones’ virtuous wisdom.

original: bye brag don du de skyes te //
analyzed: bye brag don du de skyes te //
translated: They are born for the sake of distinctions,

original: kun tu spyod pa rnam par spangs //
analyzed: kun tu spyod pa rnam par spangs //
translated: And completely abandon conduct.

original: nga ye shes rab rnam gsum ste //
analyzed: nga ye shes rab rnam gsum ste //
translated: My wisdom is threefold,

original: gang gis 'phags pa rab phye ba //
analyzed: gang gis 'phags pa rab phye ba //
translated: By which the noble ones are distinguished.🔽By which the characteristics are realized,

original: gang @188b gis mtshan nyid rtogs pa dang // dngos po rnams dang gang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: gang @188b gis mtshan nyid rtogs pa dang // dngos po rnams dang gang 'brel pa'o //
translated: And by which things are connected.

original: theg pa gnyis dang mi ldan zhing //
analyzed: theg pa gnyis dang mi ldan zhing //
translated: Not endowed with the two vehicles,

original: shes rab snang ba rnam par spangs //🔽dngos po yod par chags pas ni //
analyzed: shes rab snang ba rnam par spangs // dngos po yod par chags pas ni //
translated: And devoid of the light of wisdom,🔽The hearers will emerge

original: nyan thos rnams kyis 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyis 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: Through attachment to the existence of things.

original: sems tsam la ni 'jug pas na //
analyzed: sems tsam la ni 'jug pas na //
translated: By engaging with mind only,

original: bde gshegs shes rab dri ma med //
analyzed: bde gshegs shes rab dri ma med //
translated: The blissful ones’ wisdom is immaculate.

original: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
translated: Moreover, Mahāmati,

original: mu stegs byed 'gyur bar smra ba rnams kyi 'gyur bar lta ba rnam pa dgu yod de /
analyzed: mu stegs byed 'gyur bar smra ba rnams kyi 'gyur bar lta ba rnam pa dgu yod de /
translated: The tīrthikas’ views on transformation are of nine kinds.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dbyibs 'gyur ba dang / mtshan nyid 'gyur ba dang / rgyu 'gyur ba dang / rigs pa 'gyur ba dang / lta ba 'gyur pa dang / skye bar 'gyur ba dang / dngos po 'gyur ba dang / rkyen snang bar byed par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: dbyibs 'gyur ba dang / mtshan nyid 'gyur ba dang / rgyu 'gyur ba dang / rigs pa 'gyur ba dang / lta ba 'gyur pa dang / skye bar 'gyur ba dang / dngos po 'gyur ba dang / rkyen snang bar byed par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: the transformation of shape, the transformation of characteristics, the transformation of causes, the transformation of reasoning, the transformation of views, the transformation of birth, the transformation of things, the transformation of the appearance of conditions,🔽and the transformation of the appearance of actions.

original: bya ba snang bar byed pa'i 'gyur ba dang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: bya ba snang bar byed pa'i 'gyur ba dang / blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: 'gyur bar lta ba de dgu ste /
analyzed: 'gyur bar lta ba de dgu ste /
translated: these are the nine transformations.

original: de dag la bsams nas mu stegs byed thams cad bdag yod pa dang med pa las skye bar 'gyur bar smra ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag la bsams nas mu stegs byed thams cad bdag yod pa dang med pa las skye bar 'gyur bar smra ba yin no //
translated: Thinking of these, all tīrthikas speak of arising from the existence and nonexistence of a self.

original: de la dbyibs 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dbyibs 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the transformation of shape?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dbyibs gzhan du 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir gser gyi rgyan sna tshogs su 'gyur ba mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dbyibs gzhan du 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir gser gyi rgyan sna tshogs su 'gyur ba mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: Because the transformation of shape is seen, like seeing gold transformed into various ornaments.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: gser ni gdu bu dang / sor gdub dang / spen tog la sogs par 'gyur bas yongs su bsgyur na dbyibs sna tshogs su gyur par snang yang gser gyi dngos po ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gser ni gdu bu dang / sor gdub dang / spen tog la sogs par 'gyur bas yongs su bsgyur na dbyibs sna tshogs su gyur par snang yang gser gyi dngos po ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Gold, for example, is transformed into bracelets, rings, earrings, and so on. When it is transformed, it appears to have various shapes, but the substance of the gold does not change.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: dngos po thams cad 'gyur bar mu stegs byed kha cig rnam par rtog @189a *//
analyzed: dngos po thams cad 'gyur bar mu stegs byed kha cig rnam par rtog @189a *//
translated: some tīrthikas imagine that all things change.

original: go; kha cig ni rgyu la rtog ste /🔽de dag ni yongs su brtag pa bzung nas de bzhin du'ang ma yin /
analyzed: go; kha cig ni rgyu la rtog ste / de dag ni yongs su brtag pa bzung nas de bzhin du'ang ma yin /
translated: Some imagine the cause.

original: gzhan du'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du'ang ma yin no //
translated: But when they are examined, they are neither like that nor otherwise.

original: de ltar 'gyur ba tha dad pa thams cad kyang zho dang / 'o ma dang / chang dang / 'bras bu smin pa bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur ba tha dad pa thams cad kyang zho dang / 'o ma dang / chang dang / 'bras bu smin pa bzhin du blta'o //
translated: Thus, all transformations should be seen as being like curd, milk, beer, and ripening fruit.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: zho dang / 'o ma dang / chang dang / 'bras bu la sogs pa de dag ni mu stegs byed de dag gis 'gyur ba re rer rnam par brtags te /
analyzed: zho dang / 'o ma dang / chang dang / 'bras bu la sogs pa de dag ni mu stegs byed de dag gis 'gyur ba re rer rnam par brtags te /
translated: those tīrthikas imagine that curd, milk, beer, fruit, and so on have individual transformations.

original: de la rang gi sems snang ba phyi rol gyi dngos po dngos po med pas yod pa dang med pa ni gang yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la rang gi sems snang ba phyi rol gyi dngos po dngos po med pas yod pa dang med pa ni gang yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In this regard, since the appearances of one’s own mind are neither external entities nor non-entities, they are neither existent nor non-existent.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Thus,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi rang gi rnam par rtog pa goms pa 'jug par lta ste /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi rang gi rnam par rtog pa goms pa 'jug par lta ste /
translated: the engagement of the habitual tendencies of one’s own conceptual thoughts of childish ordinary beings is seen.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: sgyu ma dang rmi lam gyi gzugs 'byung ba mthong ba bzhin du 'di la chos gang yang 'jug pa'am ldog pa med do //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang rmi lam gyi gzugs 'byung ba mthong ba bzhin du 'di la chos gang yang 'jug pa'am ldog pa med do //
translated: just as the arising of forms in an illusion or dream is seen, there is no engagement or disengagement of any phenomena here.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: rmi lam na mo gsham gyi bu skye ba dang; 'chi ba bzhin du 'jug pa dang ldog pa'ang mthong ngo //
analyzed: rmi lam na mo gsham gyi bu skye ba dang; 'chi ba bzhin du 'jug pa dang ldog pa'ang mthong ngo //
translated: just as the birth and death of a barren woman’s son is seen in a dream, so too engagement and disengagement are seen.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ste //
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste //
translated: Regarding this, it is said:

original: 'byung dang dngos dang dbang po la //
analyzed: 'byung dang dngos dang dbang po la //
translated: Elements, entities, and faculties,🔽Time, shape, and change,

original: dus dang dbyibs dang 'gyur ba dang // srid pa bar mar bsdu bar yang //
analyzed: dus dang dbyibs dang 'gyur ba dang // srid pa bar mar bsdu bar yang //
translated: And the intermediate existence—

original: gang rtog de dag mi mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: gang rtog de dag mi mkhas pa'o //
translated: Those who conceive of them are unwise.

original: 'jig rten rten cing 'brel 'byung bar //
analyzed: 'jig rten rten cing 'brel 'byung bar //
translated: The dependently arisen world

original: rgyal ba rnam par mi rtog ste //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnam par mi rtog ste //
translated: The Victorious Ones are nonconceptual,

original: 'on kyang 'jig rten 'di dang ni //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig rten 'di dang ni //
translated: Yet they are not separate from the world.

original: @189b rkyen nyid dri za'i grong khyer bzhin //
analyzed: @189b rkyen nyid dri za'i grong khyer bzhin //
translated: Like a city of gandharvas,

original: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos chos thams cad kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i don yongs su dgrol ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba btab pa /
analyzed: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos chos thams cad kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i don yongs su dgrol ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba btab pa /
translated: Then again, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Mahāmati requested the Bhagavān, in order to be released from the meaning of the connection of all phenomena,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: mtshams sbyor ba dang / mtshams sbyor ba ma lags pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i bye brag rab tu rtogs pa gang gis bdag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan rnams mtshams sbyor ba dang / mtshams sbyor ba ma lags pa thams cad kyi thabs la mkhas pas sgra ji bzhin gyi don la chags pa'i mtshams sbyor bar mi lhung ba dang /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba dang / mtshams sbyor ba ma lags pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i bye brag rab tu rtogs pa gang gis bdag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan rnams mtshams sbyor ba dang / mtshams sbyor ba ma lags pa thams cad kyi thabs la mkhas pas sgra ji bzhin gyi don la chags pa'i mtshams sbyor bar mi lhung ba dang /
translated: through the realization of the distinction of the characteristics of connection and non-connection, I and other bodhisattva mahāsattvas, by means of the skillful means of all connections and non-connections, will not fall into the connection of attachment to the meaning of the words.

original: chos thams cad kyi mtshams sbyor ba dang / mtshams sbyor ba ma lags pa la mkhas pas tshig dang yi ge la so sor rnam par rtog pa rnams blos rab tu bcom ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshams sbyor ba dang / mtshams sbyor ba ma lags pa la mkhas pas tshig dang yi ge la so sor rnam par rtog pa rnams blos rab tu bcom ste /
translated: They are skilled in the connections and non-connections of all phenomena, and with their minds they have destroyed the discriminations of words and letters.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi 'khor du spyod cing stobs dang / dbang dang mngon par shes pa dang / gzugs kyi phyag rgyas btab pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi 'khor du spyod cing stobs dang / dbang dang mngon par shes pa dang / gzugs kyi phyag rgyas btab pa /
translated: They act in the retinues of all buddhafields, and they are sealed with the seal of the form of the powers, the masteries, and the superknowledges.

original: sprul pa'i 'od zer sna tshogs kyis mthar thug pa'i gnas bcu dang shin tu 'brel pa'i blo zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / nor bu dang / 'byung ba chen po spyod pa'i tshul lhun gyis grub pa dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: sprul pa'i 'od zer sna tshogs kyis mthar thug pa'i gnas bcu dang shin tu 'brel pa'i blo zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / nor bu dang / 'byung ba chen po spyod pa'i tshul lhun gyis grub pa dang mtshungs pa /
translated: They are like the moon, the sun, jewels, and the great elements, which are spontaneously present in their activities, and they are connected with the ten final abodes.

original: chos thams cad la rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid las lta ba rnam par bzlog cing rmi lam dang / sgyu ma la sogs pa'i chos thams @190a *//
analyzed: chos thams cad la rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid las lta ba rnam par bzlog cing rmi lam dang / sgyu ma la sogs pa'i chos thams @190a *//
translated: They have turned away from the views of all phenomena, which are the characteristics of their own discriminations, and they have seen all phenomena, such as dreams and illusions.

original: cad mthong bas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i gnas la rjes su zhugs pa /
analyzed: cad mthong bas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i gnas la rjes su zhugs pa /
translated: They have entered the abode of the buddha stage.

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad ci rigs par chos ston pas drangs te /🔽mri lam dang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs spangs pa /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad ci rigs par chos ston pas drangs te / mri lam dang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs spangs pa /
translated: He will attract all the realms of sentient beings by teaching the Dharma in an appropriate manner.

original: skye ba dang 'jig par rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba la sgra gzhan gyi rnam grangs la 'jug pa'i gnas kyis rab tu 'god par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig par rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba la sgra gzhan gyi rnam grangs la 'jug pa'i gnas kyis rab tu 'god par 'gyur ba /
translated: He will establish them in the stage of the other sound, which is free from the extremes of existence and nonexistence, and free from the concepts of arising and ceasing, with regard to all phenomena, such as dreams and illusions.

original: chos thams cad kyi mtshams sbyor ba dang / mtshams sbyor ba ma lags pa'i mtshan nyid bdag la bshad du gsol /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshams sbyor ba dang / mtshams sbyor ba ma lags pa'i mtshan nyid bdag la bshad du gsol /
translated: Please explain to me the characteristics of the connection and non-connection of all phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bdag la bshad du gsol /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bdag la bshad du gsol /
translated: May the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One explain it to me.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: legs so // legs so //
analyzed: legs so // legs so //
translated: Excellent, excellent!

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati!

original: de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang / ngas khyod la bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir shin tu legs par nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang / ngas khyod la bshad do //
translated: Therefore, listen well and keep it in mind. I will explain it to you.

original: legs so // bcom ldan 'das zhes gsol nas /
analyzed: legs so // bcom ldan 'das zhes gsol nas /
translated: Excellent, Blessed One.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la slar nyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la slar nyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Bhagavān said this to him:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: “Mahāmati,

original: chos thams cad kyi sgra ji bzhin du mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni tshad med de /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi sgra ji bzhin du mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba ni tshad med de /
translated: the attachment to the literal meaning of all dharmas is immeasurable.

original: mtshan nyid la mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / rkyen la mngon par @190b chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa la mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / skye ba dang / mi skye bar rnam par rtog pa la mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid la mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / rkyen la mngon par @190b chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa la mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / skye ba dang / mi skye bar rnam par rtog pa la mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang /
translated: It is the attachment to characteristics, the attachment to conditions, the attachment to existence and nonexistence, the attachment to the concepts of arising and non-arising,

original: 'gog pa dang 'gog pa med pa la mngon par chags pas so so rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / mtshan nyid la mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / theg pa dang theg pa ma yin pa la mngon par chags pas so sor rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: 'gog pa dang 'gog pa med pa la mngon par chags pas so so rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / mtshan nyid la mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / theg pa dang theg pa ma yin pa la mngon par chags pas so sor rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang /
translated: The connection of individual concepts through attachment to cessation and noncessation, the connection of attachment to characteristics, the connection of individual concepts through attachment to vehicles and nonvehicles,

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la so sor rnam par rtog par la mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / sa dang sa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par rtog pa la mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / rang gi rnam par rtog pa mngon par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la so sor rnam par rtog par la mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / sa dang sa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par rtog pa la mngon par chags pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / rang gi rnam par rtog pa mngon par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang /
translated: the connection of attachment to the concepts of conditioned and unconditioned phenomena, the connection of attachment to the concepts of the characteristics of the stages, the connection of attachment to one’s own concepts,

original: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs mu stegs can gyi gnas la so sor rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / theg pa gsum dang theg pa gcig mngon par rtogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs mu stegs can gyi gnas la so sor rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / theg pa gsum dang theg pa gcig mngon par rtogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba dang / blo gros chen po /
translated: the connection of discriminating the realization of the three vehicles and one vehicle,🔽Mahāmati,

original: de dag dang gzhan rnams ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi rang gi yul la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag dang gzhan rnams ni byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi rang gi yul la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba yin te /
translated: these and others are the connections of discriminating one’s own objects of foolish, ordinary beings.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams mtshams sbyor ba de dag la mtshams sbyar nas /🔽dngos po dang dngos po med par mtshams @191a *//
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams mtshams sbyor ba de dag la mtshams sbyar nas / dngos po dang dngos po med par mtshams @191a *//
translated: Foolish, ordinary beings, connected to those connections,🔽are attached to the characteristics of the connection of existence and nonexistence.

original: sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid la mngon par chags shing zhen pas so sor rnam par rtog cing /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid la mngon par chags shing zhen pas so sor rnam par rtog cing /
translated: They discriminate

original: dar gyi srin bu bzhin du rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i lta bas mtshams sbyor bar 'dod pa'i phyir rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i lta ba mtshams sbyor ba'i skud pas bdag dang gzhan la yongs su 'khri'o //
analyzed: dar gyi srin bu bzhin du rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i lta bas mtshams sbyor bar 'dod pa'i phyir rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i lta ba mtshams sbyor ba'i skud pas bdag dang gzhan la yongs su 'khri'o //
translated: Because they wish to connect with their own views, like silkworms, they wrap themselves and others in the thread of their own views.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: chos thams cad rab tu dben par mthong bas 'di la mtshams sbyor ba dang / mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid gang yang med do //
analyzed: chos thams cad rab tu dben par mthong bas 'di la mtshams sbyor ba dang / mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid gang yang med do //
translated: since all phenomena are seen to be utterly isolated, there is no connection here, nor any characteristic of connection.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i 'jug pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad la dben par lta zhing gnas so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i 'jug pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad la dben par lta zhing gnas so //
translated: because of the engagement of conceptual thought, bodhisattva mahāsattvas see and abide in the isolation of all phenomena.

original: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
translated: Moreover, Mahāmati,

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po dngos po med pa rang gi sems snang ba'i mtshan nyid du khong du chud cing snang ba med pa rang gi sems tsam gyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / yod pa dang med pa'i dngos po thams cad la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba rab tu dben par mthong bas chos thams cad la mtshams sbyor ba'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po dngos po med pa rang gi sems snang ba'i mtshan nyid du khong du chud cing snang ba med pa rang gi sems tsam gyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / yod pa dang med pa'i dngos po thams cad la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshams sbyor ba rab tu dben par mthong bas chos thams cad la mtshams sbyor ba'ang med /
translated: They see that all things that exist and do not exist are isolated from the connection of conceptuality, and so they do not connect with any phenomena.

original: mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyang med do //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid kyang med do //
translated: They also do not have the characteristics of connection.

original: blo gros chen po /🔽'di la gang yang 'ching ba'ang med /
analyzed: blo gros chen po / 'di la gang yang 'ching ba'ang med /
translated: Mahāmati,

original: 'grol ba'ang med de /
analyzed: 'grol ba'ang med de /
translated: there is nothing here that is bound or liberated.

original: gzhan du na logs par lhung ba'i blos bcings pa dang thar bar shes so //
analyzed: gzhan du na logs par lhung ba'i blos bcings pa dang thar bar shes so //
translated: Otherwise, the mind that has fallen into error understands bondage and liberation.🔽Why is that?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: It is because

original: chos thams cad la yod pa dang @191b med pa la mtshams sbyor pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad la yod pa dang @191b med pa la mtshams sbyor pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the connection with existence and nonexistence in all phenomena is not observed.

original: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
translated: Moreover, Mahāmati,

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi mtshams sbyor ba rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi mtshams sbyor ba rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The three types of linking are those of the childish ordinary beings.

original: de ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug yin te /
translated: They are desire, hatred, and delusion.

original: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'ang srid pa can gyi sred pa dang / gang la mtshams sbyar nas 'gro ba rnams kyi mtshams sbyor ba 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'ang srid pa can gyi sred pa dang / gang la mtshams sbyar nas 'gro ba rnams kyi mtshams sbyor ba 'byung ba'o //
translated: Desire is the craving for what is pleasant, and the craving for existence. Hatred is the desire to harm. Delusion is the ignorance of the four noble truths.

original: de la sems can rnams kyi 'gro ba lngar mtshams sbyar ba ni mtshams sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: de la sems can rnams kyi 'gro ba lngar mtshams sbyar ba ni mtshams sbyor ba yin te /
translated: The linking of beings to the five destinies is the linking.
